newsitem.title: USA: Trump wins okay for glass-wall slot machine room.
newsitem.headline: Trump wins okay for glass-wall slot machine room.

text.p: The state Casino Control Commission Tuesday reversed itself and gave casino magnate Donald Trump permission to open a new all-slots gaming room at the Taj Mahal visible from the Boardwalk.
The vote was 4-0 but two members complained that they were being pressured by Trump, who is chairman of Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts Inc.

Last month, the commission rejected Trump's plan for the 4,000 square foot, glassed-in Oasis Room because its outside wall was all-glass doors with direct access to the Boardwalk. That would allow unscreened access, with the potential to let minors gamble -- a violation of state law.
The new plan has no doors with direct access, said commission spokesman Daniel Henaghan.
